smells.name: TooManyFunctions

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses around the lambda ({ photoClicked() }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (medium.isImage()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: medium.isImage()
Parentheses in (width) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: width
Parentheses around the lambda ({ toggleFullscreen() }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (diffY / ViewPagerActivity.screenHeight) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: diffY / ViewPagerActivity.screenHeight
Parentheses in (percent == 100 && event.y > mLastTouchY) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: percent == 100 && event.y > mLastTouchY
Parentheses in (percent == -100 && event.y < mLastTouchY) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: percent == -100 && event.y < mLastTouchY
Parentheses in (diffY / ViewPagerActivity.screenHeight) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: diffY / ViewPagerActivity.screenHeight
Parentheses in (percent == 100 && event.y > mLastTouchY) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: percent == 100 && event.y > mLastTouchY
Parentheses in (percent == -100 && event.y < mLastTouchY) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: percent == -100 && event.y < mLastTouchY
Parentheses in (newVolume / maxVolume.toFloat()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: newVolume / maxVolume.toFloat()
Parentheses in (newBrightness / maxBrightness) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: newBrightness / maxBrightness
Parentheses around the lambda ({ _, _, _ -> setVideoSize() }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ getMedia() }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (media_grid.adapter as MediaAdapter) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: media_grid.adapter as MediaAdapter
Parentheses around the lambda ({ getDirectories() }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (directories_grid.adapter as DirectoryAdapter) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: directories_grid.adapter as DirectoryAdapter

Parentheses in (intent.data == MediaStore.Images.Media.EXTERNAL_CONTENT_URI ||
            intent.data == MediaStore.Images.Media.INTERNAL_CONTENT_URI) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: intent.data == MediaStore.Images.Media.EXTERNAL_CONTENT_URI ||
            intent.data == MediaStore.Images.Media.INTERNAL_CONTENT_URI

Parentheses in (intent.data == MediaStore.Video.Media.EXTERNAL_CONTENT_URI ||
            intent.data == MediaStore.Video.Media.INTERNAL_CONTENT_URI) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: intent.data == MediaStore.Video.Media.EXTERNAL_CONTENT_URI ||
            intent.data == MediaStore.Video.Media.INTERNAL_CONTENT_URI

Parentheses in (intent.type?.startsWith("image/") == true || intent.type == MediaStore.Images.Media.CONTENT_TYPE) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: intent.type?.startsWith("image/") == true || intent.type == MediaStore.Images.Media.CONTENT_TYPE

Parentheses in (intent.type?.startsWith("video/") == true || intent.type == MediaStore.Video.Media.CONTENT_TYPE) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: intent.type?.startsWith("video/") == true || intent.type == MediaStore.Video.Media.CONTENT_TYPE
Parentheses in (if (forward) 1f else -1f) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (forward) 1f else -1f

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

smells.name: SerialVersionUIDInSerializableClass
smells.description: A class which implements the Serializable interface does not define a correct serialVersionUID field. The serialVersionUID field should be a constant long value inside a companion object.

instances.message: The class Directory implements the Serializable interface and should thus define a serialVersionUID.
The class Medium implements the Serializable interface and should thus define a serialVersionUID.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class Directory contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called addSize
The data class Medium contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called isPng
The data class Medium contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called isGif
The data class Medium contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called isJpg
The data class Medium contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called isImage
The data class Medium contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called getMimeType

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of the class or object.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of MainActivity.

smells.name: RedundantVisibilityModifierRule
smells.description: Checks for redundant visibility modifiers. Public is the default visibility for classes. The public modifier is redundant.

instances.message: MediaAdapter is explicitly marked as public. Public is the default visibility for classes. The public modifier is redundant.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class SaveAsDialog defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
